Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk pam_snapper
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: snapper bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The snapper packages contain a tool for file system snapshot management. This update fixes the following bugs: The snapper snapshot tool provides API to deliver a file list with modifications made in between two snapshots to its D-Bus clients. Previously, no matter the file list size, the list was transferred using single D-Bus message over the bus, which was incorrect as D-Bus protocol has a hard-coded limit of message size set to 128 MiB. Consequently, if a client asked for the file list, the client always received an error message, and the snapperd daemon exited with error code. With this update, the file list is transferred using pipe inter-process communication (IPC) between snapper daemon and clients, and the client can receive larger file lists as expected. (BZ#1229353) Prior to this update, the snapperd daemon did not handle D-Bus requests from clients correctly: while handling a specific D-Bus watch, it could sometime trigger a remove event for another watch in the collection and during the following iteration step, access beyond the memory boundary allocated for the snapperd process. As a consequence, snapperd could sometime terminate unexpectedly with a segmentation fault. The D-Bus iteration cycle has been replaced with a proper lookup function, and the segmentation fault no longer occurs in this scenario. (BZ#1231684) Users of snapper are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
